chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Clatavis T Barry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court will allow release if the defendant is working at the time of revocation. Court will allow release for mental health treatment if the defendant is participating at the time of revocation. Court will allow release for vocational and educational training. Court found the defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge by the end of supervision. Court will allow the defendant to enter into a payment plan with the DOC's. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges to be collected from 25% of institution funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution in the amount of $0.00.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

- Continue with therapy and treatment through Dr. Meyer-Chan.
- Take all medications as prescribed.
- If the defendant discontinues therapy/treatment with Dr. Meyer-Chan, the DOC is to arrange for sex offender therapy and the defendant is to cooperate.
- Complete a sex offender evaluation.
- Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescribed medications.
- Defendant is to inform the agent prior to getting any prescriptions filled.
- Defendant may have NO social media accounts. Defendant is allowed to maintain an email account. Any device that allows for electronic communication is subject to inspection and must be provided to the agent on demand.
- No Contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
- No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 16 years old.
- Register as a sex offender.
- Provide a DNA sample if one has not already been provided.

Defendant Clatavis T Barry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  State placed negotiations on the record. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Cheneque W. 

As to Count 1 amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 2 days credit. Court will allow for work release if the defendant is working at the time of revocation. Court will allow for release for mental health treatment if the defendant is participating at the time of revocation. Court will allow for release for vocational and educational training. Court found the defendant eligible for the Day Reporting Center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation.


  Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days condition time imposed and stayed to be used at the agent's discretion. Court will allow for work release if the defendant is working at the time of revocation. Court will allow for release for mental health treatment if the defendant is participating at the time of revocation. Court will allow for release for vocational and educational training.
- Continue with therapy and treatment through Dr. Meyer-Chan. 
- Take all medications as prescribed.
- If the defendant discontinues therapy/treatment with Dr. Meyer-Chan, the DOC is to arrange for sex offender therapy and the defendant is to cooperate.
- Complete a sex offender evaluation.
- Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescribed medications. Defendant is to inform the agent prior to getting any prescriptions filled.
- Defendant may have NO social media accounts.  Defendant is allowed to maintain an email account.  Any device that allows for electronic communication is subject to inspection and must be provided to the agent on demand.
- No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
- No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 16 years old.
- Register as a sex offender.
- Provide a DNA sample if one has not already been provided.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Court will allow the defendant to enter into a payment plan with the Department of Corrections. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges to be collected from 25% of institution funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
- Restitution in the amount of $0.00
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA)


Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter in support of the defendant received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court report from the defense received and filed.

To the charge in the Amended Information:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Defendant advised he will have to register as a sex offender and may be subject to Chapter 980 filing.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 6-1-2015 at 8:30am for sentencing in Branch 25.

Defendant Clatavis T Barry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 25.  Amended Information filed by the state: Third Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, 940.225(3).
Branch 25 in is jury trial and is unable to hear the matter.  Parties have reached a resolution. Judge Wagner in Branch 38 will hear the matter.  Parties notified. Case sent forthwith.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Clatavis T Barry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State. Parties anticipate a resolution in this matter. Defense counsel is working to obtain psychological records of the defendant. Parties request a projected plea date be set. Court advised parties to be prepared to proceed to sentencing on the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant advised that the No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with AMT and NKT or their residence and family.  No contact with children under the age of 18 years of age with out supervision. No use of Facebook or social media.

Defendant Clatavis T Barry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMT, HER MOTHER NKT, AND THEIR HOUSE & FAMILY.  NO CONTACT WITH CHILDREN UNDER 18 YEARS OF AGE WITHOUT SUPERVISION. NO USE OF FACEBOOK OR SOCIAL MEDIA.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Clatavis T Barry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Clatavis T Barry in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
